p: Solidago canadensis L. leaves were collected during the flowering phase at the turn of July and August 2019, in Suchoraba (49°58′37″ N 20°11′49″ E) in southern Poland ( Figure 1). The species occurred there massively, in the form of a compact yield, in a fallow field. The harvested fresh Canadian goldenrod leaf material was sorted such that pure plant material was selected for drying. Then the leaves were placed in a single layer on sheets of filter paper and dried in the dark, in an dryer at a constant temperature of 25 °C (Wamed SUP-100, Warsaw, Poland) for 7 days. Properly dried leaves had a natural color and crumbled easily. The dried plant material was stored in a silica gel desiccator.
